## FadingFeature namespace

Namespace with support functions for implementors of `FadingFeature`<!-- -->.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare namespace FadingFeature 
```

## Functions

|  Function | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [addRenderHelper(object, viewRanges, fadeNear, fadeFar, updateUniforms, additionalCallback)](./harp-materials.fadingfeature.addrenderhelper.md) | As three.js is rendering the transparent objects last (internally), regardless of their renderOrder value, we set the transparent value to false in the \[\[onAfterRenderCall\]\]. In \[\[onBeforeRender\]\], the function \[\[calculateDepthFromCameraDistance\]\] sets it to true if the fade distance value is less than 1. |
|  [isEnabled(fadingMaterial)](./harp-materials.fadingfeature.isenabled.md) | Checks if feature is enabled based on feature params.<!-- -->Fading feature will be disabled if fadeFar is undefined or fadeFar &lt;<!-- -->= 0.0. This function is crucial for shader switching (chunks injection), whenever feature state changes between enabled/disabled. Current approach is to keep feature on (once enabled) whenever fading params are reasonable, even if it causes full fade in, no transparency. |
|  [onBeforeCompile(fadingMaterial, shader)](./harp-materials.fadingfeature.onbeforecompile.md) | This function should be called on implementors of FadingFeature in the <code>onBeforeCompile</code> callback of that material. It adds the required code to the shaders and declares the new uniforms that control fading based on view distance. |
|  [patchGlobalShaderChunks()](./harp-materials.fadingfeature.patchglobalshaderchunks.md) | Patch the THREE.ShaderChunk on first call with some extra shader chunks. |
|  [updateFadingFeature(fadingMaterial)](./harp-materials.fadingfeature.updatefadingfeature.md) | Update the internals of the <code>FadingFeature</code> depending on the value of \[\[fadeNear\]\]. The fading feature will be disabled if fadeFar &lt;<!-- -->= 0.0. |
